docs.lead_paragraph: In the old days, there were parties to which you weren’t invited, and it didn’t matter because you didn’t know about them. And if you did, at least there were no pictures.
docs.abstract: Joyce Wadler Booming blog waxes nostalgic for time before Facebook when people were spared knowledge of events to which they were not invited.

headline.seo: In Your Face(book) — Here’s the Party You Weren’t Invited To

docs.snippet: Increasingly, social technology businesses are taking an antisocial attitude to callers, making themselves available to customers via e-mail, Twitter messages and Web sites....
docs.lead_paragraph: Increasingly, social technology businesses are taking an antisocial attitude to callers, making themselves available to customers via e-mail, Twitter messages and Web sites.
docs.abstract: Social technology businesses are increasingly unlikely to provide live phone support for their customers, citing limited staff and the advantages of e-mail and automated systems; trend has frustrated many older users who are accustomed to speaking with a real person when service is problematic.

headline.seo: Tech Companies Leave Phone Calls Behind

docs.snippet: Excitement about Facebook did not keep the major indexes from losing ground for the third week in a row....
docs.lead_paragraph: Excitement about Facebook did not keep the major indexes from losing ground for the third week in a row.
docs.abstract: Investors drive American stock indexes to their worst weekly performance of 2012, as excitement about Facebook's stock offering fails to chase away widespread pessimism about the Euro crisis and slow growth in the US and China.

headline.seo: Markets End Week on With Losses

docs.snippet: Recent privacy controversies for Google and other Internet companies show the pains of an industry intent on changing the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: Recent privacy controversies for Google and other Internet companies show the pains of an industry intent on changing the world.
docs.abstract: News analysis; Google once proclaimed 'Don't be evil' as its unofficial company motto, but privacy controversies for the company and other Internet firms illustrate the difficulty of building technologies that produce an entirely new kind of culture; if tech is building a new culture, with new senses of the private and the shared, the failure of overstepping boundaries is also the only way to learn how far those boundaries have shifted.

headline.seo: Don’t Be Evil but Don’t Miss the Tech Train
headline.main: Don’t Be Evil, but Don’t Miss the Train
headline.print_headline: Don’t Be Evil, But Don’t Miss The Train

docs.snippet: Apps that let users find friends whenever they are nearby are to be on display at the South by Southwest technology, music and film conference....
docs.lead_paragraph: Apps that let users find friends whenever they are nearby are to be on display at the South by Southwest technology, music and film conference.
docs.abstract: Smartphone apps that help users find friends whenever they are nearby will be featured at the South by Southwest technology, music and film conference in Austin, Tex; most of these services are dependent on Facebook; app developers are seeking attention from technology enthusiasts, entrepreneurs and venture capitalists who attend show to see the latest in start-ups and innovative ideas.

headline.seo: New Apps Connect to Friends Nearby
